simulator.framework.faultmodels
Interface NetworkFaultModel

All Known Implementing Classes:
BERFaultModel, BlackoutFaultModel, BlockMessageFaultModel, DropMessagesFaultModel, OverrideMessageFaultModel
public interface NetworkFaultModel

Interface for defining fault model objects. The fault model can decide how to drop faults based on other information, but this interface is used to hook the fault model into the network scheduler.

Method Summary
 boolean canDeliver(Payload payload)
          Ask fault model if the message can be delivered
 boolean canStart(Payload payload)
          Notify the fault model that a message is starting
 void registerNetworkScheduler(NetworkScheduler ns)
          Give the fault model a reference to the network scheduler.
 

Method Detail

registerNetworkScheduler

void registerNetworkScheduler(NetworkScheduler ns)
Give the fault model a reference to the network scheduler. This allows it to call the fault interface methods, such as isMessagePending and dropCurrentMessage.

Parameters:
ns - The network scheduler this fault model is registered with.

canStart

boolean canStart(Payload payload)
Notify the fault model that a message is starting

Parameters:
payload - Message that is starting

canDeliver

boolean canDeliver(Payload payload)
Ask fault model if the message can be delivered

Parameters:
payload - Message to be delivered
Returns:
true if the message can be delivered
